card.name: Absorb
card.ability: Counter target spell. You gain 3 life.
card.flavor: "Your presumption is your downfall."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If cast targeting a spell that can't be countered, the life gain still happens, but that spell is not countered.

card.name: Addle
card.ability: Choose a color. Target player reveals his or her hand and you choose a card of that color from it. That player discards that card.
card.flavor:
"I'll wring out your tiny mind like a sponge."
—Urborg witch

card.name: Æther Rift
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, discard a card at random. If you discard a creature card this way, return it from your graveyard to the battlefield unless any player pays 5 life.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : First, the card is discarded. Then, in turn order, each player is given the option to pay 5 life. Then, if no player paid 5 life, the card is put onto the battlefield from the graveyard.
10/1/2009 : The card is actually discard, so anything which triggers on a discard will trigger. Such abilities will wait to go on the stack until after this ability has completely resolved.

card.name: Aggressive Urge
card.ability:
Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: The power of the wild, concentrated in a single charge.

card.name: Agonizing Demise
card.ability:
Kicker {1}{R} (You may pay an additional {1}{R} as you cast this spell.)
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. If Agonizing Demise was kicked, it deals damage equal to that creature's power to the creature's controller.

card.name: Alabaster Leech
card.ability: White spells you cast cost {W} more to cast.
card.flavor:
"Its stones seem to serve a healing function, but removing them intact is an exhausting process."
—Tolarian research notes

card.name: Alloy Golem
card.ability:
As Alloy Golem enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Alloy Golem is the chosen color. (It's still an artifact.)
card.flavor:
"We turned old weapons into new warriors."
—Jhoira, master artificer
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If Alloy Golem phases out, you do not pick a new color when it phases in.

card.name: Ancient Kavu
card.ability: {2}: Ancient Kavu becomes colorless until end of turn.
card.flavor: Those with the ability to change their nature survived Phyrexia's biological attacks. Everything else died.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Making a permanent colorless does not make it into an artifact.

card.name: Ancient Spring
card.ability:
Ancient Spring enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Ancient Spring: Add {W}{B} to your mana pool.

card.name: Andradite Leech
card.ability:
Black spells you cast cost {B} more to cast.
{B}: Andradite Leech gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Older specimens are completely encrusted with gems, which serve as both armor and weapons."
—Tolarian research notes

card.name: Angel of Mercy
card.ability:
Flying
When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
card.flavor:
"In times like these, people need to be reminded of compassion."
—Sisay

card.name: Angelic Shield
card.ability:
Creatures you control get +0/+1.
Sacrifice Angelic Shield: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"If only an angel's wings could shelter us all."
—Barrin
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : Angelic Shield goes to the graveyard when you activate the ability, but the targeted creature does not get returned until the ability resolves. All your creatures lose the bonus while the ability is on the stack which may result in the targeted creature being destroyed before the return can take effect.

card.name: Annihilate
card.ability:
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Whatever Yawgmoth marks, dies. There is no escape."
—Tsabo Tavoc, Phyrexian general

card.name: Archaeological Dig
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Archaeological Dig: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Ardent Soldier
card.ability:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell.)
Vigilance
If Ardent Soldier was kicked, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.

card.name: Armadillo Cloak
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has trample.
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.
card.flavor:
"Don't laugh. It works."
—Yavimaya ranger

card.name: Armored Guardian
card.ability:
{1}{W}{W}: Target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
{1}{U}{U}: Armored Guardian gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can activate the ability that grants shroud in response to this card being targeted by a spell or ability. If you do so, then (if this is the spell or abilities only target) the spell or ability will be countered since this card will now be an illegal target.

card.name: Artifact Mutation
card.ability: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. Put X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is that artifact's converted mana cost.
card.flavor:
"From shards and splinters I call forth my living horde."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This spell is countered and you get no Saprolings if the artifact is an illegal target on resolution.

card.name: Assault // Battery
card.ability:
Assault deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
//
Put a 3/3 green Elephant creature token onto the battlefield.

card.name: Atalya, Samite Master
card.ability: {X}, {T}: Choose one — Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn; or you gain X life. Spend only white mana this way.
card.flavor: "Healing is a gift the divine ones have shared with us. It is a sacred trust."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Cost modifiers which add a cost are not restricted to only white mana.
10/4/2004 : Spending only white mana applies to the ability regardless of which mode you choose.

card.name: Aura Mutation
card.ability: Destroy target enchantment. Put X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield, where X is that enchantment's converted mana cost.
card.flavor:
"Life can be found in all things, even things unnatural."
—Multani, maro-sorcerer
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This spell is countered and you get no Saprolings if the enchantment is an illegal target on resolution.

card.name: Aura Shards
card.ability: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, you may destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor: Gaea forged her soldiers into self-wielding weapons that struck down all impurities.

card.name: Backlash
card.ability: Tap target untapped creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to its controller.
card.flavor: Darigaaz decided his foe would be more useful as a weapon.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Being untapped is a targeting restriction. If the target is tapped before this spell resolves, then this spell is countered.

card.name: Barrin's Spite
card.ability: Choose two target creatures controlled by the same player. Their controller chooses and sacrifices one of them. Return the other to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"Only vengeance matters now."
—Barrin
card.ruling: 5/1/2008 : The player chooses which one to sacrifice as the spell resolves. If only one of the targets is still legal at that time, then the player must choose that one to sacrifice.

card.name: Barrin's Unmaking
card.ability: Return target permanent to its owner's hand if that permanent shares a color with the most common color among all permanents or a color tied for most common.

card.name: Benalish Emissary
card.ability:
Kicker {1}{G} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} as you cast this spell.)
When Benalish Emissary enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, destroy target land.

card.name: Benalish Heralds
card.ability: {3}{U}, {T}: Draw a card.
card.flavor: The detailed dispatch could be summarized in four words: "Time is running out."

card.name: Benalish Lancer
card.ability:
Kicker {2}{W} (You may pay an additional {2}{W} as you cast this spell.)
If Benalish Lancer was kicked, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it and with first strike.

card.name: Benalish Trapper
card.ability: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
card.flavor: "I'm up here. You're down there. Now who's the lower life form?"

card.name: Bend or Break
card.ability: Each player separates all nontoken lands he or she controls into two piles. For each player, one of his or her piles is chosen by one of his or her opponents of his or her choice. Destroy all lands in the chosen piles. Tap all lands in the other piles.

card.name: Bind
card.ability:
Counter target activated ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"The battlefield is cluttered enough. Be still."
—Multani, maro-sorcerer

card.name: Blazing Specter
card.ability:
Flying, haste
Whenever Blazing Specter deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.

card.name: Blind Seer
card.ability: {1}{U}: Target spell or permanent becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"I think he sees more than he lets on."
—Gerrard
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If you change the color of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the color change until the end of the turn.

card.name: Blinding Light
card.ability: Tap all nonwhite creatures.
card.flavor: An angel's sword impales only the body; her righteousness penetrates the soul.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Will not tap a creature that is both white and another color.

card.name: Bloodstone Cameo
card.ability: {T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"The stone whispers to me of dragon's fire and darkness. I wish I'd never pried it from the figurehead of that sunken Keldon longship."
—Isel, master carver

card.name: Blurred Mongoose
card.ability:
Blurred Mongoose can't be countered.
Shroud (This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor:
"The mongoose blew out its candle and was asleep in bed before the room went dark."
—Llanowar fable
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It can be targeted while on the stack. Shroud only works while it is on the battlefield.
10/4/2004 : Counterspells can be cast that target it, but when they resolve they simply don't counter it since it can't be countered.

card.name: Bog Initiate
card.ability: {1}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"Urborg's magic is strong. Did Urza send you to protect us or to protect against us?"
—Urborg witch, to Barrin

card.name: Breaking Wave
card.ability:
You may cast Breaking Wave any time you could cast an instant if you pay {2} more to cast it.
Simultaneously untap all tapped creatures and tap all untapped creatures.

card.name: Breath of Darigaaz
card.ability:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell.)
Breath of Darigaaz deals 1 damage to each creature without flying and each player. If Breath of Darigaaz was kicked, it deals 4 damage to each creature without flying and each player instead.

card.name: Callous Giant
card.ability: If a source would deal 3 or less damage to Callous Giant, prevent that damage.
card.flavor: "The invasion has awoken slumbering mountains," noted Urza. "Good. We can use all the help we can get."

card.name: Canopy Surge
card.ability:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell.)
Canopy Surge deals 1 damage to each creature with flying and each player. If Canopy Surge was kicked, it deals 4 damage to each creature with flying and each player instead.

card.name: Capashen Unicorn
card.ability: {1}{W}, {T}, Sacrifice Capashen Unicorn: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor: Capashen riders were stern and humorless even before their ancestral home was reduced to rubble.

card.name: Captain Sisay
card.ability: {T}: Search your library for a legendary card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Her leadership forged the Weatherlight's finest crew.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Cauldron Dance
card.ability:
Cast Cauldron Dance only during combat.
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Return it to your hand at the beginning of the next end step.
You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Its controller sacrifices it at the beginning of the next end step.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the targeted creature card in the graveyard is removed before resolution, this spell will be countered since its only target will be invalid.
10/4/2004 : You can cast this spell when you have no creature card in your hand. If this happens, simply ignore that part of the spell. You still put the graveyard creature onto the battlefield and still return it to your hand at the beginning of the end step.
10/4/2004 : You must have a creature in your graveyard to cast this spell since it requires a valid target.

card.name: Chaotic Strike
card.ability:
Cast Chaotic Strike only during combat after blockers are declared.
Flip a coin. If you win the flip, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Draw a card.

card.name: Charging Troll
card.ability:
Vigilance
{G}: Regenerate Charging Troll.
card.flavor: They stop for nothing, not even the end of a battle.

card.name: Chromatic Sphere
card.ability: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Chromatic Sphere: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Let insight and energy be your guides."
—The Blind Seer, to Gerrard
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : This is a mana ability, which means it can be activated as part of the process of casting a spell or activating another ability. If that happens you get the mana right away, but you don't get to look at the drawn card until you have finished casting that spell or activating that ability.

card.name: Cinder Shade
card.ability:
{B}: Cinder Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{R}, Sacrifice Cinder Shade: Cinder Shade deals damage equal to its power to target creature.

card.name: Coalition Victory
card.ability: You win the game if you control a land of each basic land type and a creature of each color.
card.flavor:
"You can build a perfect machine out of imperfect parts."
—Urza
card.ruling: 9/25/2006 : When Coalition Victory resolves, it checks for the five basic land types (Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, Forest) and the five colors (white, blue, black, red, green). If a single land has multiple types and/or a single creature is multiple colors, it will count all those types and/or colors.

card.name: Coastal Tower
card.ability:
Coastal Tower enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: The Capashen built the highest towers in Benalia to afford themselves the best view.

card.name: Collapsing Borders
card.ability: Domain — At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player gains 1 life for each basic land type among lands he or she controls. Then Collapsing Borders deals 3 damage to him or her.
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.
2/1/2009 : How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.
2/1/2009 : A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control -- they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

card.name: Collective Restraint
card.ability: Domain — Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {X} for each creature he or she controls that's attacking you, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.
card.ruling:
2/1/2007 : In the Two-Headed Giant format, you still only have to pay once per creature.
2/1/2009 : To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.
2/1/2009 : How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.
2/1/2009 : A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control -- they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

card.name: Cremate
card.ability:
Exile target card from a graveyard.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: Death's embrace need not be cold.
card.ruling:
10/1/2012 : You must be able to target a card in a graveyard to cast Cremate.
10/1/2012 : If the target card is no longer in the graveyard when Cremate tries to resolve, it will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won’t draw a card.

card.name: Crimson Acolyte
card.ability:
Protection from red
{W}: Target creature gains protection from red until end of turn.
card.flavor:
The faithful will walk through streams of fire and emerge unscathed.
—Crimson acolyte creed

card.name: Crosis, the Purger
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Crosis, the Purger deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{B}. If you do, choose a color, then that player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of that color.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You choose the color during resolution. This means your opponent does not get to react after knowing the color you chose.

card.name: Crosis's Attendant
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice Crosis's Attendant: Add {U}{B}{R} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "Crosis is the eye of the ur-dragon, piercing illusion and darkness."

card.name: Crown of Flames
card.ability:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{R}: Return Crown of Flames to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"All my life I've fought these monsters. Today I finish that fight."
—Barrin

card.name: Crusading Knight
card.ability:
Protection from black
Crusading Knight gets +1/+1 for each Swamp your opponents control.
card.flavor: "My only dream is to destroy the nightmares of others."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It counts all opponents' swamps.

card.name: Crypt Angel
card.ability:
Flying, protection from white
When Crypt Angel enters the battlefield, return target blue or red creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Once an angel, now an abomination.

card.name: Crystal Spray
card.ability:
Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another until end of turn.
Draw a card.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
10/4/2004 : Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
10/4/2004 : It can't change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
10/4/2004 : It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
10/4/2004 : You choose the words to change on resolution.
10/4/2004 : You can't change proper nouns (i.e. card names) such as "Island Fish Jasconius".
10/4/2004 : Changing the text of a spell will not allow you to change the targets of the spell because the targets were chosen when the spell was cast. The text change will (probably) cause it to be countered since the targets will be illegal.
10/4/2004 : If you change the text of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the text change until the effect wears off.
10/4/2004 : It can be used to change a land's type from one basic land type to another. For example, Forest can be changed to Island so it produces blue mana. It doesn't change the name of any permanent.

card.name: Cursed Flesh
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 and has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor: Misery, filth, disease—all things that bring suffering to the world—only make Phyrexians more dangerous.

card.name: Darigaaz, the Igniter
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Darigaaz, the Igniter deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, choose a color, then that player reveals his or her hand and Darigaaz deals damage to the player equal to the number of cards of that color revealed this way.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You choose the color during resolution. This means your opponent does not get to react after knowing the color you chose.

card.name: Darigaaz's Attendant
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice Darigaaz's Attendant: Add {B}{R}{G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "Darigaaz is the breath of the ur-dragon, burning away the burdens of mortality."

card.name: Death or Glory
card.ability: Separate all creature cards in your graveyard into two piles. Exile the pile of an opponent's choice and return the other to the battlefield.

card.name: Defiling Tears
card.ability: Until end of turn, target creature becomes black, gets +1/-1, and gains "{B}: Regenerate this creature."
card.flavor: Serra's living warriors looked on in horror. "Where is our Lady now?" they cried.

card.name: Stand // Deliver
card.ability:
Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
//
Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

card.name: Desperate Research
card.ability: Name a card other than a basic land card. Then reveal the top seven cards of your library and put all of them with that name into your hand. Exile the rest.

card.name: Devouring Strossus
card.ability:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature.
Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Devouring Strossus.

card.name: Dismantling Blow
card.ability:
Kicker {2}{U} (You may pay an additional {2}{U} as you cast this spell.)
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
If Dismantling Blow was kicked, draw two cards.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If the target is not legal on resolution, the spell is countered and you do not get to draw the two cards.

card.name: Disrupt
card.ability:
Counter target instant or sorcery spell unless its controller pays {1}.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: Teferi wanted no part of Urza's battle plans, but both agreed the Phyrexian portal must be closed.
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : You draw a card regardless of whether the targeted spell was countered or {1} was paid.

card.name: Distorting Wake
card.ability: Return X target nonland permanents to their owners' hands.
card.flavor: Gerrard savored a grim smile as the Phyrexian portals disappeared behind the Weatherlight.

card.name: Divine Presence
card.ability: If a source would deal 4 or more damage to a creature or player, that source deals 3 damage to that creature or player instead.
card.flavor:
"Serra's light isn't easily extinguished."
—Reya Dawnbringer
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This is not preventing damage since it does not use the word "prevent". It is a replacement.

card.name: Do or Die
card.ability: Separate all creatures target player controls into two piles. Destroy all creatures in the pile of that player's choice. They can't be regenerated.

card.name: Drake-Skull Cameo
card.ability: {T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"A strange skull was turned up by an Ephran farmer's plow. I traded a copper ring for the ‘ox skull.' It resonates of the sea and danger."
—Isel, master carver

card.name: Dream Thrush
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: Whether for good or ill, their arrival always means change.

card.name: Dredge
card.ability:
Sacrifice a creature or land.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"I'd strip away the world to see what's under it, but I'd never just leave it to these Phyrexian parasites and their false god."
—Urborg witch

card.name: Dromar, the Banisher
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Dromar, the Banisher deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{U}. If you do, choose a color, then return all creatures of that color to their owners' hands.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You choose the color during resolution. This means your opponent does not get to react after knowing the color you chose.

card.name: Dromar's Attendant
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice Dromar's Attendant: Add {W}{U}{B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "Dromar is the wings of the ur-dragon, sweeping away all opposition."

card.name: Dueling Grounds
card.ability:
No more than one creature can attack each turn.
No more than one creature can block each turn.
card.flavor:
"You think you can stop me?" hissed Tsabo.
"I think I can kill you," replied Gerrard.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability affects all players.

card.name: Duskwalker
card.ability:
Kicker {3}{B} (You may pay an additional {3}{B} as you cast this spell.)
If Duskwalker was kicked, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it and with fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

card.name: Elfhame Palace
card.ability:
Elfhame Palace enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Llanowar has seven elfhames, or kingdoms, each with its own ruler. Their palaces are objects of awe, wonder, and envy.

card.name: Elfhame Sanctuary
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, you skip your draw step this turn and shuffle your library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you have more than one of these on the battlefield, you get to use them all and you don't skip multiple draw steps.
10/4/2004 : The "if you do" means "if you search your library". You get to skip your draw step and shuffle your deck even if you don't find (or choose not to find) a basic land.
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Elvish Champion
card.ability: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
card.flavor:
"For what are leaves but countless blades
To fight a countless foe on high."
—Skyshroud hymn
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It affects Elves controlled by all players, not just yours.
8/1/2005 : This card is now an Elf but has been reworded so that it does not give itself the bonus.

card.name: Empress Galina
card.ability: {U}{U}, {T}: Gain control of target legendary permanent. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.flavor: "Above the waves you may be mighty indeed, but down here you belong to me."

card.name: Essence Leak
card.ability:
Enchant permanent
As long as enchanted permanent is red or green, it has "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this permanent unless you pay its mana cost."
card.flavor:
"We define the boundaries of reality; they don't define us."
—Teferi
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It can enchant a permanent that is not red or green, but it doesn't do anything in that case.

card.name: Exclude
card.ability:
Counter target creature spell.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"I don't have time for you right now."
—Teferi

card.name: Exotic Curse
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Domain — Enchanted creature gets -1/-1 for each basic land type among lands you control.
card.flavor:
Fouler than a necromancer's kiss.
—Jamuraan expression
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.
2/1/2009 : How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.
2/1/2009 : A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control -- they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

card.name: Explosive Growth
card.ability:
Kicker {5} (You may pay an additional {5} as you cast this spell.)
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. If Explosive Growth was kicked, that creature gets +5/+5 until end of turn instead.

card.name: Fact or Fiction
card.ability: Reveal the top five cards of your library. An opponent separates those cards into two piles. Put one pile into your hand and the other into your graveyard.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You choose which pile to put into your hand.
10/4/2004 : The revealed cards are revealed in order, so that all players know what order they were on the library.

card.name: Faerie Squadron
card.ability:
Kicker {3}{U} (You may pay an additional {3}{U} as you cast this spell.)
If Faerie Squadron was kicked, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it and with flying.

card.name: Fertile Ground
card.ability:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of any color to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
card.flavor: As Phyrexians descended, Multani paused to reflect on the beauty that might never be seen again.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The color of mana to be generated is chosen when tapping the land for mana.

card.name: Fight or Flight
card.ability: At the beginning of each opponent's combat, separate all creatures that player controls into two piles. Only creatures in the pile of his or her choice can attack this turn.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : Creatures which enter the battlefield (or cards which become creatures) after the beginning of combat ability resolves are not placed in either pile. Since they weren't in the chosen pile, they won't be able to attack.
8/1/2008 : If you have two of these, then you will separate the creatures into piles twice, and the opponent will choose a pile each time. Only creatures that were in both of the chosen piles can attack.
8/1/2008 : The effect is best understood if you read it as "creatures not in the chosen pile can't attack."

card.name: Firebrand Ranger
card.ability: {G}, {T}: You may put a basic land card from your hand onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: A skilled ranger can glance at the mud on your boots and tell where you last camped.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This does not count as your one land you can normally play each turn.
5/1/2007 : Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional.  When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.

card.name: Fires of Yavimaya
card.ability:
Creatures you control have haste.
Sacrifice Fires of Yavimaya: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

card.name: Firescreamer
card.ability: {R}: Firescreamer gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: In the dark, it's nearly invisible—until it exhales.

card.name: Frenzied Tilling
card.ability: Destroy target land. Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor:
"Beneath her scars, Dominaria's beauty yet shines."
—Multani, maro-sorcerer
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
1/24/2013 : If the target land is an illegal target when Frenzied Tilling tries to resolve, the spell will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won’t search your library for a basic land card.

card.name: Galina's Knight
card.ability: Protection from red
card.flavor:
"Are they on our side?" asked Sisay.
"If they kill Phyrexians they are," replied Gerrard.

card.name: Geothermal Crevice
card.ability:
Geothermal Crevice enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Geothermal Crevice: Add {B}{G} to your mana pool.

card.name: Ghitu Fire
card.ability:
You may cast Ghitu Fire any time you could cast an instant if you pay {2} more to cast it.
Ghitu Fire deals X damage to target creature or player.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The extra 2 mana to cast it as an Instant does not count as part of the mana cost.

card.name: Glimmering Angel
card.ability:
Flying
{U}: Glimmering Angel gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor:
"We turned to see where the blow came from and saw only a distant light."
—Capashen lord
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can activate the ability that grants shroud in response to this card being targeted by a spell or ability. If you do so, then (if this is the spell or abilities only target) the spell or ability will be countered since this card will now be an illegal target.

card.name: Global Ruin
card.ability: Each player chooses from the lands he or she controls a land of each basic land type, then sacrifices the rest.
card.flavor:
"The earth shook, the sky rained fire, and it seemed the world was ending."
—Benalish refugee
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a land counts as multiple basic land types, you can choose it for either or for both of those land types.
8/15/2010 : You sacrifice all lands other than the chosen ones. Since you can only choose lands with basic land types, any non-basic lands that don't have a basic land type (even if they have some other land type, as in the case of Cloudpost) are necessarily going to be sacrificed.

card.name: Goblin Spy
card.ability: Play with the top card of your library revealed.
card.flavor:
"Isn't he on our side?"
"Yep."
"Why's he spyin' on us?"
"Don't ask."
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : The top card of your library isn't in your hand, so you can't suspend it, cycle it, discard it, or activate any of its activated abilities.
4/15/2013 : If the top card of your library is a land, you can play it if you could play a land.
4/15/2013 : If the top card of your library changes while you're casting a spell or activating an ability, the new top card won't be revealed until you finish casting that spell or activating that ability.
4/15/2013 : When playing with the top card of your library revealed, if an effect tells you to draw several cards, reveal each one before you draw it.

card.name: Goham Djinn
card.ability:
{1}{B}: Regenerate Goham Djinn.
Goham Djinn gets -2/-2 as long as black is the most common color among all permanents or is tied for most common.

card.name: Halam Djinn
card.ability:
Haste
Halam Djinn gets -2/-2 as long as red is the most common color among all permanents or is tied for most common.

card.name: Hanna, Ship's Navigator
card.ability: {1}{W}{U}, {T}: Return target artifact or enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: "I never thought I'd spend my life fighting. I'm a maker, not a destroyer."

card.name: Harrow
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Harrow, sacrifice a land.
Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: No spot in nature is truly barren.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The sacrifice of a land is part of the cost of casting Harrow. You can't pay this cost more than once to get a multiple effect.
10/4/2004 : The two lands do not count toward your normal one land you can play each turn.
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Harsh Judgment
card.ability:
As Harsh Judgment enters the battlefield, choose a color.
If an instant or sorcery spell of the chosen color would deal damage to you, it deals that damage to its controller instead.
card.flavor:
"At least they remember me."
—Gerrard

card.name: Hate Weaver
card.ability: {2}: Target blue or red creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Let my hate fuel your fury."

card.name: Heroes' Reunion
card.ability: Target player gains 7 life.
card.flavor:
"You helped save my people from a Phyrexian fate. Did you think I wouldn't return the favor?"
—Eladamri, to Gerrard

card.name: Holy Day
card.ability: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
card.flavor:
"Will history remember this as the day demons arrived or the day saviors arrived?"
—Barrin

card.name: Hooded Kavu
card.ability: {B}: Hooded Kavu gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor: The spread of its hood eclipses all hope.

card.name: Horned Cheetah
card.ability: Whenever Horned Cheetah deals damage, you gain that much life.
card.flavor: "I think she wants us to eat it," said Squee, staring at the oily carcass the cheetah had dragged to their fire.

card.name: Hunting Kavu
card.ability: {1}{R}{G}, {T}: Exile Hunting Kavu and target creature without flying that's attacking you.
card.flavor: Dominarians gladly fought alongside kavu . . . until the kavu figured out some Dominarians were quite tasty.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Being "without flying" is a targeting restriction. The ability will be countered if the target gains flying before the ability resolves.

card.name: Hypnotic Cloud
card.ability:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)
Target player discards a card. If Hypnotic Cloud was kicked, that player discards three cards instead.

card.name: Irrigation Ditch
card.ability:
Irrigation Ditch enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Irrigation Ditch: Add {G}{U} to your mana pool.

card.name: Jade Leech
card.ability: Green spells you cast cost {G} more to cast.
card.flavor:
"It took magic to extract one of the stones and five people to carry it."
—Tolarian research notes

card.name: Juntu Stakes
card.ability: Creatures with power 1 or less don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
card.flavor:
"Those who can't survive are of no consequence."
—Tsabo Tavoc

card.name: Kangee, Aerie Keeper
card.ability:
Kicker {X}{2} (You may pay an additional {X}{2} as you cast this spell.)
Flying
When Kangee, Aerie Keeper enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, put X feather counters on it.
Other Bird creatures get +1/+1 for each feather counter on Kangee, Aerie Keeper.

card.name: Kavu Aggressor
card.ability:
Kicker {4} (You may pay an additional {4} as you cast this spell.)
Kavu Aggressor can't block.
If Kavu Aggressor was kicked, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.

card.name: Kavu Chameleon
card.ability:
Kavu Chameleon can't be countered.
{G}: Kavu Chameleon becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"They weren't part of my plan, but Gaea insisted."
—Urza
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The new color replaces all previous colors.
10/4/2004 : Counterspells can be cast that target it, but when they resolve they simply don't counter it since it can't be countered.

card.name: Kavu Climber
card.ability: When Kavu Climber enters the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor: The appearance of the first kavu surprised Multani. As they continued to emerge, he no longer had any doubts about Yavimaya's ability to defend herself.

card.name: Kavu Lair
card.ability: Whenever a creature with power 4 or greater enters the battlefield, its controller draws a card.
card.flavor: As a dark rain of Phyrexians fell from the sky, fountains of kavu erupted from the ground.

card.name: Kavu Monarch
card.ability:
Kavu creatures have trample.
Whenever another Kavu enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Kavu Monarch.
card.flavor: Kavu emerged all across Dominaria, but the first and the strongest came from Yavimaya.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Does give itself Trample, but does not give itself a +1/+1 counter.

card.name: Kavu Runner
card.ability: Kavu Runner has haste as long as no opponent controls a white or blue creature.

card.name: Kavu Scout
card.ability: Domain — Kavu Scout gets +1/+0 for each basic land type among lands you control.
card.flavor: The kavu evolved for centuries deep inside Dominaria, and some can draw from its strength.
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.
2/1/2009 : How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.
2/1/2009 : A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control -- they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

card.name: Kavu Titan
card.ability:
Kicker {2}{G} (You may pay an additional {2}{G} as you cast this spell.)
If Kavu Titan was kicked, it enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it and with trample.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If the Kavu Titan was kicked, it enters the battlefield with trample and will keep this ability until it leaves the battlefield.

card.name: Keldon Necropolis
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{4}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Keldon Necropolis deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Liberate
card.ability: Exile target creature you control. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor:
"Not everyone gets a second chance."
—Hanna
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The creature returns after "at the beginning of the end step" abilities trigger, so any such abilities on the creature will not trigger this turn.

card.name: Lightning Dart
card.ability: Lightning Dart deals 1 damage to target creature. If that creature is white or blue, Lightning Dart deals 4 damage to it instead.
card.flavor: Broken and punctured by dozens of Phyrexian portals, the angry sky began to spit lightning back at the world.

card.name: Llanowar Cavalry
card.ability: {W}: Llanowar Cavalry gains vigilance until end of turn.
card.flavor: For the first time, elves welcomed Benalish soldiers into the forest with something other than arrows.

card.name: Llanowar Elite
card.ability:
Kicker {8} (You may pay an additional {8} as you cast this spell.)
Trample
If Llanowar Elite was kicked, it enters the battlefield with five +1/+1 counters on it.

card.name: Llanowar Knight
card.ability: Protection from black
card.flavor: Her armor and steed were borrowed, but her courage was hers alone.

card.name: Llanowar Vanguard
card.ability: {T}: Llanowar Vanguard gets +0/+4 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Llanowar rallied around Eladamri's banner and united in his name.

card.name: Loafing Giant
card.ability: Whenever Loafing Giant attacks or blocks, put the top card of your library into your graveyard. If that card is a land card, prevent all combat damage Loafing Giant would deal this turn.
card.flavor: "Forget it. I'm not getting up today."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If it somehow blocks multiple creatures in a single combat, the triggered ability only triggers once.

card.name: Lobotomy
card.ability: Target player reveals his or her hand, then you choose a card other than a basic land card from it. Search that player's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as the chosen card and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You only get to pick one card from the player's hand.
10/4/2004 : If the player has no cards in their hand, you still get to look through their deck, but you do not get to exile any cards.
10/4/2004 : It exiles the chosen card plus all others in the hand, library, and graveyard. Some people thought the chosen card was not exiled due to some vague wording.
10/4/2004 : Does not affect cards on the battlefield.
2/1/2005 : The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

card.name: Lotus Guardian
card.ability:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Lotus fields are too valuable to leave undefended.

card.name: Mages' Contest
card.ability: You and target spell's controller bid life. You start the bidding with a bid of 1. In turn order, each player may top the high bid. The bidding ends if the high bid stands. The high bidder loses life equal to the high bid. If you win the bidding, counter that spell.

card.name: Spite // Malice
card.ability:
Counter target noncreature spell.
//
Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

card.name: Mana Maze
card.ability: Players can't cast spells that share a color with the spell most recently cast this turn.
card.flavor:
"Those who know only one path to victory can never hope to triumph."
—The Blind Seer
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Does not affect the first spell cast each turn.
10/4/2004 : If a spell's color was changed while on the stack, use the color at the time it was when you started announcement, not as it currently is on the stack or as it was at the time it resolved.

card.name: Maniacal Rage
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't block.
card.flavor: "Remember me?" Tahngarth roared. "Now I'll repay you for my stay on Rath"

card.name: Manipulate Fate
card.ability:
Search your library for three cards, exile them, then shuffle your library.
Draw a card.

card.name: Marauding Knight
card.ability:
Protection from white
Marauding Knight gets +1/+1 for each Plains your opponents control.
card.flavor:
"They ride our trails as if they were designed to," said the guard.
"They were," replied Gerrard.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Counts plains controlled by all opponents.

card.name: Metathran Aerostat
card.ability:
Flying
{X}{U}: You may put a creature card with converted mana cost X from your hand onto the battlefield. If you do, return Metathran Aerostat to its owner's hand.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can activate the ability in response to itself and get more than one creature card onto the battlefield before this returns to its owner's hand.

card.name: Metathran Transport
card.ability:
Flying
Metathran Transport can't be blocked by blue creatures.
{U}: Target creature becomes blue until end of turn.

card.name: Metathran Zombie
card.ability: {B}: Regenerate Metathran Zombie.
card.flavor:
"Rise, metathran. You shall serve a nobler cause in death."
—Tsabo Tavoc, Phyrexian general

card.name: Meteor Storm
card.ability: {2}{R}{G}, Discard two cards at random: Meteor Storm deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: The storm wasn't an omen. It was the fulfillment of one.

card.name: Might Weaver
card.ability: {2}: Target red or white creature gains trample until end of turn. (If the creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
card.flavor: "Let my strength harden your resolve."

card.name: Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer
card.ability:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.
card.flavor: "The world calls and I answer."

card.name: Mourning
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-0.
{B}: Return Mourning to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Barrin waited for the nausea to pass or for Urza to say something else. He waited in vain.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If attached to an opponent's creature, only you can activate the ability to return it.

card.name: Nightscape Apprentice
card.ability:
{U}, {T}: Put target creature you control on top of its owner's library.
{R}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

card.name: Nightscape Master
card.ability:
{U}{U}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
{R}{R}, {T}: Nightscape Master deals 2 damage to target creature.

card.name: Noble Panther
card.ability: {1}: Noble Panther gains first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor: Unlike many hunters, these panthers have no need for camouflage. They're fast enough to catch any prey.

card.name: Nomadic Elf
card.ability: {1}{G}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "I've journeyed across Dominaria. Phyrexians are everywhere. Plague is everywhere. There's no place left to hide."

card.name: Obliterate
card.ability:
Obliterate can't be countered.
Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and lands. They can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: For his family, Barrin made a funeral pyre of Tolaria.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Counterspells can be cast that target it, but when they resolve they simply don't counter it since it can't be countered.

card.name: Obsidian Acolyte
card.ability:
Protection from black
{W}: Target creature gains protection from black until end of turn.
card.flavor:
The truthful will stand in the gaze of death and escape unharmed.
—Obsidian acolyte creed

card.name: Opt
card.ability:
Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: "We need alternatives, Hanna," yelled Gerrard. "Now"

card.name: Ordered Migration
card.ability: Domain — Put a 1/1 blue Bird creature token with flying onto the battlefield for each basic land type among lands you control.
card.flavor: "Birds reach all parts of the world," said Barrin. "They will make excellent scouts."
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.
2/1/2009 : How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.
2/1/2009 : A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control -- they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

card.name: Orim's Touch
card.ability:
Kicker {1} (You may pay an additional {1} as you cast this spell.)
Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. If Orim's Touch was kicked, prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to that creature or player this turn instead.

card.name: Overabundance
card.ability: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana to his or her mana pool of any type that land produced, and Overabundance deals 1 damage to him or her.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The ability deals one damage even if the land produces no mana when it was tapped to use a mana ability. This can happen with lands that produce a variable amount of mana.
10/4/2004 : This card's ability is a mana ability. There is no chance to respond to it in order to prevent the damage. If you want to prevent the damage, you need to use a prevention spell or ability prior to tapping the land for mana.

card.name: Overload
card.ability:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell.)
Destroy target artifact if its converted mana cost is 2 or less. If Overload was kicked, destroy that artifact if its converted mana cost is 5 or less instead.

card.name: Pain // Suffering
card.ability:
Target player discards a card.
//
Destroy target land.

card.name: Phantasmal Terrain
card.ability:
Enchant land
As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.
card.ruling: 10/15/2006 : Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

card.name: Phyrexian Altar
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"Your life was meaningless, but your death will glorify Yawgmoth."
—Tsabo Tavoc

card.name: Phyrexian Battleflies
card.ability:
Flying
{B}: Phyrexian Battleflies gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
card.flavor: After encountering them, Squee finally lost his appetite for bugs.

card.name: Phyrexian Delver
card.ability: When Phyrexian Delver enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. You lose life equal to that card's converted mana cost.

card.name: Phyrexian Infiltrator
card.ability: {2}{U}{U}: Exchange control of Phyrexian Infiltrator and target creature. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.flavor:
"It is Yawgmoth's will incarnate: an efficient machine that replaces inefficient flesh."
—Tsabo Tavoc
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It is possible to activate this ability in response to itself and generate some odd combinations. For example, if you control this card and another creature, you can use this card's ability and target the creature you control. You can then use this card's ability again and target a creature your opponent controls. The second usage resolves first and you get your opponent's creature in exchange for this one. The first usage then resolves and swaps your other creature for the Infiltrator so you get it back. The net effect is that you can swap any creature you have for any of theirs if you can pay this ability twice. Note that your opponent does get the chance to use the Infiltrator if they have the mana in between your two usages and can mess you up.
10/4/2004 : There is no effect if the same player controls both creatures when it resolves.

card.name: Phyrexian Lens
card.ability: {T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"There's nothing I wouldn't give to achieve victory. Can you say the same?"
—Tsabo Tavoc, to Gerrard

card.name: Phyrexian Reaper
card.ability: Whenever Phyrexian Reaper becomes blocked by a green creature, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: It desires only to help others shed the itchy wet skin of life.

card.name: Phyrexian Slayer
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Phyrexian Slayer becomes blocked by a white creature, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: Benalia was only the first nation victimized by Tsabo Tavoc's specialized killers.

card.name: Pincer Spider
card.ability:
Kicker {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell.)
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
If Pincer Spider was kicked, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.

card.name: Plague Spitter
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Plague Spitter deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
When Plague Spitter dies, Plague Spitter deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

card.name: Plague Spores
card.ability: Destroy target nonblack creature and target land. They can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"Breathe deep, Dominaria. Breathe deep and die."
—Tsabo Tavoc, Phyrexian general

card.name: Planar Portal
card.ability: {6}, {T}: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: The sky split, and the air crackled and roiled. The Phyrexian invasion of Dominaria had finally begun.

card.name: Pledge of Loyalty
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from the colors of permanents you control. This effect doesn't remove Pledge of Loyalty.
card.flavor: Urza convinced many Dominarians not only to set aside their differences, but to embrace them.

card.name: Pouncing Kavu
card.ability:
Kicker {2}{R} (You may pay an additional {2}{R} as you cast this spell.)
First strike
If Pouncing Kavu was kicked, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it and with haste.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If the Pouncing Kavu is kicked, it enters the battlefield with haste and will keep this ability until it leaves the battlefield.

card.name: Power Armor
card.ability: Domain — {3}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each basic land type among lands you control.
card.flavor:
"Great peril demands formidable weaponry."
—Urza
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.
2/1/2009 : How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.
2/1/2009 : A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control -- they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

card.name: Prison Barricade
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Kicker {1}{W} (You may pay an additional {1}{W} as you cast this spell.)
If Prison Barricade was kicked, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it and with "Prison Barricade can attack as though it didn't have defender."
card.ruling: 8/1/2005 : If the Prison Barricade is kicked, it enters the battlefield with the ability to attack as if it did not have Defender and will keep this ability until it leaves the battlefield.

card.name: Probe
card.ability:
Kicker {1}{B} (You may pay an additional {1}{B} as you cast this spell.)
Draw three cards, then discard two cards.
If Probe was kicked, target player discards two cards.

card.name: Prohibit
card.ability:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell.)
Counter target spell if its converted mana cost is 2 or less. If Prohibit was kicked, counter that spell if its converted mana cost is 4 or less instead.

card.name: Protective Sphere
card.ability: {1}, Pay 1 life: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by a source of your choice that shares a color with the mana spent on this activation cost. (Colorless mana prevents no damage.)

card.name: Psychic Battle
card.ability: Whenever a player chooses one or more targets, each player reveals the top card of his or her library. The player who reveals the card with the highest converted mana cost may change the target or targets. If two or more cards are tied for highest cost, the target or targets remain unchanged. Changing targets this way doesn't trigger this ability.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : With the Split Cards, use the higher of the two costs on the card to compare with the other card.
10/4/2004 : You can change all, some, or none of the targets.
10/4/2004 : You can't change the number of targets, choose an illegal target, or make something get targeted more than once.
10/4/2004 : An empty library will have no card to reveal, so a player with an empty library has no card to compare. The effect looks for the highest cost card of the cards that actually are revealed.

card.name: Pulse of Llanowar
card.ability: If a basic land you control is tapped for mana, it produces mana of a color of your choice instead of any other type.
card.flavor:
"Gaea's memory is eternal, and she exists in all things."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This does not change the amount of mana gained. It just makes all the mana generated by the basic land be of a single color of your choice.
10/4/2004 : You can choose a different color each time a basic land is tapped.
10/4/2004 : You can choose the same color or mana the land would normally produce.

card.name: Pure Reflection
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a creature spell, destroy all Reflections. Then that player puts an X/X white Reflection creature token onto the battlefield, where X is the converted mana cost of that spell.

card.name: Pyre Zombie
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Pyre Zombie is in your graveyard, you may pay {1}{B}{B}. If you do, return Pyre Zombie to your hand.
{1}{R}{R}, Sacrifice Pyre Zombie: Pyre Zombie deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Quirion Elves
card.ability:
As Quirion Elves enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color to your mana pool.

card.name: Quirion Sentinel
card.ability: When Quirion Sentinel enters the battlefield, add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor: All elvenkind stood against Phyrexia. The Quirion nation deployed its most spiritual adepts, who wielded the power of their native soil.
card.ruling:
8/1/2008 : This is not a mana ability. It uses the stack, and can be responded to.
10/1/2009 : You get the mana whether you want it or not. If you don't spend it, it will disappear at the end of the current step (or phase).
1/25/2011 : You get the mana whether you want it or not. If you don't spend it, it will disappear at the end of the current step (or phase).

card.name: Quirion Trailblazer
card.ability: When Quirion Trailblazer enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. If you do, shuffle your library.
card.flavor: "All that matters is the path ahead."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The land does not count toward your normal limit of playing one land per turn.
10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Rage Weaver
card.ability: {2}: Target black or green creature gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
card.flavor: "Let my passion spur your victory."

card.name: Raging Kavu
card.ability:
Flash
Haste
card.flavor: It took Yavimaya a thousand years to breed them, but it took only seconds for them to prove their worth.

card.name: Rainbow Crow
card.ability:
Flying
{1}: Rainbow Crow becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: Children claim no two feathers are exactly the same color, then eagerly gather them for proof.

card.name: Rampant Elephant
card.ability: {G}: Target creature blocks Rampant Elephant this turn if able.
card.flavor: No matter how righteous the cause, it helps to bring along some muscle.

card.name: Ravenous Rats
card.ability: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
card.flavor: Nothing is sacred to the rats. Everything is simply another meal.

card.name: Razorfoot Griffin
card.ability:
Flying
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
card.flavor:
"Do griffins fight to defend their homes or purely for sport?"
—Sisay

card.name: Reckless Assault
card.ability: {1}, Pay 2 life: Reckless Assault deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"How will you fight an enemy that cares nothing for itself?"
—The Blind Seer

card.name: Reckless Spite
card.ability: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life.
card.flavor:
"Death is such an exquisite sensation."
—Tsabo Tavoc, Phyrexian general

card.name: Recoil
card.ability: Return target permanent to its owner's hand. Then that player discards a card.
card.flavor: Anything sent into a plagued world is bound to come back infected.

card.name: Recover
card.ability:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: As Barrin exhumed his daughter's body, he finally realized the full price of his faith in Urza.

card.name: Repulse
card.ability:
Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: "You aren't invited."

card.name: Restock
card.ability: Return two target cards from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Restock.
card.flavor:
"We hid such stockpiles all over Rath. We should continue that practice here."
—Lin Sivvi

card.name: Restrain
card.ability:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target attacking creature this turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Hanna would give up her own life before she'd abandon the Weatherlight."
—Sisay

card.name: Reviving Dose
card.ability:
You gain 3 life.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: As healers battled each plague, they learned more about the next.

card.name: Reviving Vapors
card.ability: Reveal the top three cards of your library and put one of them into your hand. You gain life equal to that card's converted mana cost. Put all other cards revealed this way into your graveyard.

card.name: Rewards of Diversity
card.ability: Whenever an opponent casts a multicolored spell, you gain 4 life.
card.flavor:
"Everything is in place. Nothing can happen that isn't part of my plan."
—Urza

card.name: Reya Dawnbringer
card.ability:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor: A beacon of hope for a battered army.

card.name: Riptide Crab
card.ability:
Vigilance
When Riptide Crab dies, draw a card.
card.flavor: It sleeps with its claws open.

card.name: Rith, the Awakener
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Rith, the Awakener deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{G}. If you do, choose a color, then put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield for each permanent of that color.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You choose the color during resolution. This means your opponent does not get to react after knowing the color you chose.

card.name: Rith's Attendant
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice Rith's Attendant: Add {R}{G}{W} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "Rith is the claw of the ur-dragon, scattering seeds of devastation."

card.name: Rogue Kavu
card.ability: Whenever Rogue Kavu attacks alone, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "I know how this one feels," said Urza. "It's not like others of its kind and has been shunned for its differences."

card.name: Rooting Kavu
card.ability: When Rooting Kavu dies, you may exile it. If you do, shuffle all creature cards from your graveyard into your library.

card.name: Rout
card.ability:
You may cast Rout any time you could cast an instant if you pay {2} more to cast it.
Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

card.name: Ruby Leech
card.ability:
First strike
Red spells you cast cost {R} more to cast.
card.flavor:
"Its gems didn't stop pulsating until they were completely removed."
—Tolarian research notes

card.name: Ruham Djinn
card.ability:
First strike
Ruham Djinn gets -2/-2 as long as white is the most common color among all permanents or is tied for most common.

card.name: Sabertooth Nishoba
card.ability: Trample, protection from blue and from red
card.flavor: They sneer at the terrestrial dangers found on peaks and shores, eager to prove themselves against new and even mightier foes.

card.name: Salt Marsh
card.ability:
Salt Marsh enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
Only death breeds in stagnant water.
—Urborg saying

card.name: Samite Archer
card.ability:
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
{T}: Samite Archer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: "I can preserve ten lives by taking one."

card.name: Samite Ministration
card.ability: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by a source of your choice. Whenever damage from a black or red source is prevented this way this turn, you gain that much life.

card.name: Sapphire Leech
card.ability:
Flying
Blue spells you cast cost {U} more to cast.
card.flavor:
"The subject's wings are clearly vestigial. We suspect the gems somehow keep it aloft."
—Tolarian research notes

card.name: Saproling Infestation
card.ability: Whenever a player kicks a spell, you put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: "My army took centuries to gather," remarked Urza. "Yavimaya seems to conjure hers out of thin air."

card.name: Saproling Symbiosis
card.ability:
You may cast Saproling Symbiosis any time you could cast an instant if you pay {2} more to cast it.
Put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield for each creature you control.

card.name: Savage Offensive
card.ability:
Kicker {G} (You may pay an additional {G} as you cast this spell.)
Creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn. If Savage Offensive was kicked, they get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Only affects creatures you control when this spell resolves.

card.name: Scarred Puma
card.ability: Scarred Puma can't attack unless a black or green creature also attacks.
card.flavor: It's not eager to lose the other eye.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It means "a black or green creature other than itself attacks".

card.name: Scavenged Weaponry
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When Scavenged Weaponry enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
card.flavor: "The Phyrexians have progressed," admired Urza. "Their parts are interchangeable."

card.name: Scorching Lava
card.ability:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you cast this spell.)
Scorching Lava deals 2 damage to target creature or player. If Scorching Lava was kicked, that creature can't be regenerated this turn and if it would die this turn, exile it instead.

card.name: Scouting Trek
card.ability: Search your library for any number of basic land cards. Reveal those cards, then shuffle your library and put them on top of it.
card.flavor:
"I have chosen my path. Who will walk it with me?"
—Eladamri

card.name: Searing Rays
card.ability: Choose a color. Searing Rays deals damage to each player equal to the number of creatures of that color that player controls.
card.flavor:
"This is a battle of pawns, for the highest stakes imaginable."
—Urza
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You choose the color on resolution. Your opponent does not get to respond between the color choice and the damage happening. They need to use any damage prevention they want before you choose a color.

card.name: Seashell Cameo
card.ability: {T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"Today a seashell fell from the empty sky here in Kinymu, a hundred leagues from the sea. I'm torn—shall I carve a woman or a bird?"
—Isel, master carver

card.name: Seer's Vision
card.ability:
Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
Sacrifice Seer's Vision: Look at target player's hand and choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

card.name: Serpentine Kavu
card.ability: {R}: Serpentine Kavu gains haste until end of turn.
card.flavor: Under Yavimaya's peaceful facade beat the hearts of many savage beasts.

card.name: Shackles
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
{W}: Return Shackles to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: "It could be worse," said Gerrard, looking around. "Well, maybe not."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Shackles does not tap the creature when it enters the battlefield.

card.name: Shimmering Wings
card.ability:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has flying. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{U}: Return Shimmering Wings to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"Wings are but fins for swimming the sky."
—Empress Galina

card.name: Shivan Emissary
card.ability:
Kicker {1}{B} (You may pay an additional {1}{B} as you cast this spell.)
When Shivan Emissary enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

card.name: Shivan Harvest
card.ability: {1}{R}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonbasic land.
card.flavor:
"The blood of your ancestors ran heavy on this soil. Now it's your turn to sacrifice for the glory of Shiv."
—Viashino heretic

card.name: Shivan Oasis
card.ability:
Shivan Oasis enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Only the hardiest explorers survive to eat the fruit.

card.name: Shivan Zombie
card.ability: Protection from white
card.flavor: Barbarians long for a glorious death in battle. Phyrexia was eager to grant that wish.

card.name: Shoreline Raider
card.ability: Protection from Kavu
card.flavor:
"This strange new beast makes for an excellent meal. Get me more."
—Empress Galina

card.name: Simoon
card.ability: Simoon deals 1 damage to each creature target opponent controls.
card.flavor: Hot wind whipped up as if the weather itself wanted to fight Phyrexians.

card.name: Skittish Kavu
card.ability: Skittish Kavu gets +1/+1 as long as no opponent controls a white or blue creature.
card.flavor: Fierce when roused, this breed of kavu is easily distracted by a strong voice or melodic tune.

card.name: Skizzik
card.ability:
Kicker {R} (You may pay an additional {R} as you cast this spell.)
Trample, haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Skizzik unless it was kicked.

card.name: Sky Weaver
card.ability: {2}: Target white or black creature gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: "Let my wisdom give you wings."

card.name: Sleeper's Robe
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to an opponent, you may draw a card.

card.name: Slimy Kavu
card.ability: {T}: Target land becomes a Swamp until end of turn.
card.flavor: Its slime liquefies the ground as efficiently as its fangs shred prey.

card.name: Slinking Serpent
card.ability: Forestwalk
card.flavor: It winds its way through undergrowth as easily as it swims through shallows.

card.name: Smoldering Tar
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, target player loses 1 life.
Sacrifice Smoldering Tar: Smoldering Tar deals 4 damage to target creature. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

card.name: Soul Burn
card.ability:
Spend only black and/or red mana on X.
Soul Burn deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more than the amount of {B} spent on X, the player's life total before Soul Burn dealt damage, or the creature's toughness.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Will give 1 life for each black mana used, but not more life than the amount of unprevented damage that is dealt.

card.name: Sparring Golem
card.ability: Whenever Sparring Golem becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
card.flavor: "Part drill sergeant, part training dummy," thought Gerrard. "I hope it can stand up to a real war."

card.name: Spinal Embrace
card.ability:
Cast Spinal Embrace only during combat.
Untap target creature you don't control and gain control of it. It gains haste until end of turn. At the beginning of the next end step, sacrifice it. If you do, you gain life equal to its toughness.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The sacrifice is mandatory. The last "if you do" only fails if for some reason you could not sacrifice.

card.name: Spirit of Resistance
card.ability: As long as you control a permanent of each color, prevent all damage that would be dealt to you.
card.flavor:
"Our victory must come from all of Dominaria, or it will not come."
—Urza
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : A permanent which is of multiple colors counts as each of its colors.

card.name: Spirit Weaver
card.ability: {2}: Target green or blue creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Let my hope be your shield."

card.name: Spreading Plague
card.ability: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, destroy all other creatures that share a color with it. They can't be regenerated.
