card.name: Stalking Assassin
card.ability:
{3}{U}, {T}: Tap target creature.
{3}{B}, {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.

card.name: Stand or Fall
card.ability: At the beginning of combat on your turn, separate all creatures defending player controls into two piles. Only creatures in the pile of that player's choice can block this turn.

card.name: Sterling Grove
card.ability:
Other enchantments you control have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
{1}, Sacrifice Sterling Grove: Search your library for an enchantment card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

card.name: Stormscape Apprentice
card.ability:
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
{B}, {T}: Target player loses 1 life.

card.name: Stormscape Master
card.ability:
{W}{W}, {T}: Target creature gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
{B}{B}, {T}: Target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

card.name: Strength of Unity
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Domain — Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each basic land type among lands you control.
card.flavor: All Dominarians agreed on one thing: they would not go down without a fight.
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.
2/1/2009 : How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.
2/1/2009 : A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control -- they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

card.name: Stun
card.ability:
Target creature can't block this turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"They certainly are well protected. Too bad for them they're not well balanced."
—Sisay
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Must be used before blockers are declared in order to affect blocking decisions. You can't wait to see what your opponent declares and then try to stop them.
10/4/2004 : You can use it after combat or even on a creature which can't possibly block this turn because it's that player's turn to attack, but it generally has no effect other than to let you draw a card.

card.name: Sulam Djinn
card.ability:
Trample
Sulam Djinn gets -2/-2 as long as green is the most common color among all permanents or is tied for most common.

card.name: Sulfur Vent
card.ability:
Sulfur Vent enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Sulfur Vent: Add {U}{R} to your mana pool.

card.name: Sunscape Apprentice
card.ability:
{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{U}, {T}: Put target creature you control on top of its owner's library.

card.name: Sunscape Master
card.ability:
{G}{G}, {T}: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
{U}{U}, {T}: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The first ability only affects creatures you control at the time the ability resolves.

card.name: Sway of Illusion
card.ability:
Any number of target creatures become the color of your choice until end of turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"I suggest you take a closer look."
—Tidal visionary
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can cast this and choose to target zero creatures and effectively just draw a card.

card.name: Tainted Well
card.ability:
Enchant land
When Tainted Well enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted land is a Swamp.
card.flavor:
"No, you get the water. I ain't thirsty."
—Squee

card.name: Tangle
card.ability:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Each attacking creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
card.flavor: Gaea battles rampant death with abundant life.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It identifies the creatures that are not going to untap at the time this spell resolves.

card.name: Tectonic Instability
card.ability: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, tap all lands its controller controls.
card.flavor:
"Think of the problems we'll face if you uproot entire continents," said Urza.
"I have," replied Teferi, "but the alternative is worse."

card.name: Teferi's Care
card.ability:
{W}, Sacrifice an enchantment: Destroy target enchantment.
{3}{U}{U}: Counter target enchantment spell.
card.flavor:
"If I do nothing else, I will protect my people."
—Teferi

card.name: Teferi's Moat
card.ability:
As Teferi's Moat enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Creatures of the chosen color without flying can't attack you.
card.flavor:
"Isolation is not the answer."
—Urza, to Teferi.

card.name: Teferi's Response
card.ability:
Counter target spell or ability an opponent controls that targets a land you control. If a permanent's ability is countered this way, destroy that permanent.
Draw two cards.
card.ruling:
1/1/2006 : Remember that a spell only targets something if it is an Aura or uses the phrase "target" in its text.
1/1/2006 : If none of the targeted spell's targets is a land when Teferi's Response would resolve, Teferi's Response is countered on resolution due to having no legal targets.

card.name: Tek
card.ability: Tek gets +0/+2 as long as you control a Plains, has flying as long as you control an Island, gets +2/+0 as long as you control a Swamp, has first strike as long as you control a Mountain, and has trample as long as you control a Forest.

card.name: Temporal Distortion
card.ability:
Whenever a creature or land becomes tapped, put an hourglass counter on it.
Each permanent with an hourglass counters on it doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, remove all hourglass counters from permanents that player controls.

card.name: Thicket Elemental
card.ability:
Kicker {1}{G} (You may pay an additional {1}{G} as you cast this spell.)
When Thicket Elemental enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, you may reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card. If you do, put that card onto the battlefield and shuffle all other cards revealed this way into your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The "if you do" means "if you choose to reveal cards". You still shuffle if you have no creature card in your library.

card.name: Thornscape Apprentice
card.ability:
{R}, {T}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
{W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

card.name: Thornscape Master
card.ability:
{R}{R}, {T}: Thornscape Master deals 2 damage to target creature.
{W}{W}, {T}: Target creature gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

card.name: Thunderscape Apprentice
card.ability:
{B}, {T}: Target player loses 1 life.
{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Thunderscape Master
card.ability:
{B}{B}, {T}: Target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
{G}{G}, {T}: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.

card.name: Tidal Visionary
card.ability: {T}: Target creature becomes the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: Beneath the waves, things appear the way merfolk want them to.

card.name: Tigereye Cameo
card.ability: {T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"An elvish adventurer unearthed this stone in Jolrael's jungle. Now it's truly fit for display in one of her palaces."
—Isel, master carver

card.name: Tinder Farm
card.ability:
Tinder Farm enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Tinder Farm: Add {R}{W} to your mana pool.

card.name: Tolarian Emissary
card.ability:
Kicker {1}{W} (You may pay an additional {1}{W} as you cast this spell.)
Flying
When Tolarian Emissary enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, destroy target enchantment.

card.name: Tower Drake
card.ability:
Flying
{W}: Tower Drake gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Young tower drakes quickly learn to maneuver among Benalia's many spires.

card.name: Tranquility
card.ability: Destroy all enchantments.
card.flavor: The plagues robbed Dominaria of all but its dreams. Eladamri hoped dreams were enough.

card.name: Traveler's Cloak
card.ability:
Enchant creature
As Traveler's Cloak enters the battlefield, choose a land type.
When Traveler's Cloak enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Enchanted creature has landwalk of the chosen type.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Can affect basic or non-basic types, but it must be for a specific type. The chosen type must be an existing land type. See the glossary of the comprehensive rulebook for more details on existing land types.

card.name: Treefolk Healer
card.ability: {2}{W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor: Protected by druids for untold centuries, the forest began to return the favor.

card.name: Trench Wurm
card.ability: {2}{R}, {T}: Destroy target nonbasic land.
card.flavor:
"Their arrival marks the end of Yawgmoth's subtlety."
—Urza

card.name: Treva, the Renewer
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Treva, the Renewer deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{W}. If you do, choose a color, then you gain 1 life for each permanent of that color.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You choose the color during resolution. This means your opponent does not get to react after knowing the color you chose.

card.name: Treva's Attendant
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice Treva's Attendant: Add {G}{W}{U} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: "Treva is the voice of the ur-dragon, demanding cries of worship."

card.name: Tribal Flames
card.ability: Domain — Tribal Flames deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control.
card.flavor:
"Fire is the universal language."
—Jhoira, master artificer
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.
2/1/2009 : How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.
2/1/2009 : A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control -- they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

card.name: Troll-Horn Cameo
card.ability: {T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor:
"I found a troll-horn fragment in the wooded foothills of Hurloon, and it keeps growing larger. I wonder, is the horn recreating itself or the troll?"
—Isel, master carver

card.name: Tsabo Tavoc
card.ability:
First strike, protection from legendary creatures
{B}{B}, {T}: Destroy target legendary creature. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor: "I might almost pity my enemies—if it wasn't so amusing to watch them die."
card.ruling: 8/1/2005 : The destroy ability only works on Legendary creatures, not on other Legendary cards.

card.name: Tsabo's Assassin
card.ability: {T}: Destroy target creature if it shares a color with the most common color among all permanents or a color tied for most common. A creature destroyed this way can't be regenerated.

card.name: Tsabo's Decree
card.ability: Choose a creature type. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all creature cards of that type. Then destroy all creatures of that type that player controls. They can't be regenerated.

card.name: Tsabo's Web
card.ability:
When Tsabo's Web enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Each land with an activated ability that isn't a mana ability doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Lands with Cycling are affected.
4/15/2013 : A mana ability is an ability that doesn't target and could put mana into a player's mana pool when it resolves.
4/15/2013 : A mana ability is an ability that (1) isn't a loyalty ability, (2) doesn't target, and (3) could put mana into a player's mana pool when it resolves.

card.name: Turf Wound
card.ability:
Target player can't play land cards this turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"I can't imagine how anyone lives in Shiv, let alone why they choose to stay."
—Sisay
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Stops the player from playing a land, but not from putting a land onto the battlefield using a spell or ability.

card.name: Twilight's Call
card.ability:
You may cast Twilight's Call any time you could cast an instant if you pay {2} more to cast it.
Each player returns all creature cards from his or her graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor:
Twilight falls. We rise.
—Necropolis inscription
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : All the creature cards enter the battlefield simultaneously.
10/4/2004 : For purposes of ordering any continuous effects of the creatures, the current player (not the controller of this spell) decides the ordering regardless of which player is putting the creatures onto the battlefield.

card.name: Undermine
card.ability: Counter target spell. Its controller loses 3 life.
card.flavor: "Which would you like first, the insult or the injury?"

card.name: Urborg Drake
card.ability:
Flying
Urborg Drake attacks each turn if able.
card.flavor: Relentless as the sea, remorseless as death.

card.name: Urborg Emissary
card.ability:
Kicker {1}{U} (You may pay an additional {1}{U} as you cast this spell.)
When Urborg Emissary enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, return target permanent to its owner's hand.

card.name: Urborg Phantom
card.ability:
Urborg Phantom can't block.
{U}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by Urborg Phantom this turn.
card.flavor: A chilling fog with teeth of ice.

card.name: Urborg Shambler
card.ability: Other black creatures get -1/-1.
card.flavor: A writhing mass of rot, with sharp claws and a vicious spirit.

card.name: Urborg Skeleton
card.ability:
Kicker {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell.)
{B}: Regenerate Urborg Skeleton.
If Urborg Skeleton was kicked, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.

card.name: Urborg Volcano
card.ability:
Urborg Volcano enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Deep in the heart of Urborg lie massive volcanoes whose thick black smoke covers the land with perpetual darkness.

card.name: Urza's Filter
card.ability: Multicolored spells cost up to {2} less to cast.
card.flavor: "It's a tool for aiding my other tools," explained Urza. "Now they'll work in harmony."

card.name: Urza's Rage
card.ability:
Kicker {8}{R} (You may pay an additional {8}{R} as you cast this spell.)
Urza's Rage can't be countered by spells or abilities.
Urza's Rage deals 3 damage to target creature or player. If Urza's Rage was kicked, instead it deals 10 damage to that creature or player and the damage can't be prevented.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : This spell has a self-replacement in it . This means that if Urza's Rage is kicked, the 3 damage is replaced with 10 unpreventable damage before any other replacements can be applied. For example, you can't use Healing Salve to prevent the 3 damage before it gets changed.
10/4/2004 : You can target this spell with spells and abilities, so you can change its target. Those spells and abilities just can't counter it.
10/4/2004 : The damage is unpreventable, but it can be affected by replacement effects.
10/4/2004 : It can be countered by game rules, such as by having all its targets be illegal. Game rules are neither spells or abilities.
10/4/2004 : Counterspells can be cast that target it, but when they resolve they simply don't counter it since it can't be countered.

card.name: Utopia Tree
card.ability: {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor: The fruit of this fabled tree takes on the flavor of whatever food you love most.

card.name: Verdeloth the Ancient
card.ability:
Kicker {X} (You may pay an additional {X} as you cast this spell.)
Saproling creatures and other Treefolk creatures get +1/+1.
When Verdeloth the Ancient enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, put X 1/1 green Saproling creature tokens onto the battlefield.

card.name: Verduran Emissary
card.ability:
Kicker {1}{R} (You may pay an additional {1}{R} as you cast this spell.)
When Verduran Emissary enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated.

card.name: Viashino Grappler
card.ability: {G}: Viashino Grappler gains trample until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"They've returned for the mana rig, but it no longer belongs to them."
—Viashino bey

card.name: Vicious Kavu
card.ability: Whenever Vicious Kavu attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: As battle raged in Shiv, a strange new ally appeared from below the ravaged ground.

card.name: Vigorous Charge
card.ability:
Kicker {W} (You may pay an additional {W} as you cast this spell.)
Target creature gains trample until end of turn. Whenever that creature deals combat damage this turn, if Vigorous Charge was kicked, you gain life equal to that damage.

card.name: Vile Consumption
card.ability: All creatures have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this creature unless you pay 1 life."
card.flavor: The plague moved faster than an army and was far more deadly.

card.name: Vodalian Hypnotist
card.ability: {2}{B}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.flavor: "Deceit is the heart of war."

card.name: Vodalian Merchant
card.ability: When Vodalian Merchant enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.
card.flavor: Not choosing sides in a war can be dangerous—but lucrative.

card.name: Vodalian Serpent
card.ability:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell.)
Vodalian Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
If Vodalian Serpent was kicked, it enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.

card.name: Vodalian Zombie
card.ability: Protection from green
card.flavor:
"Every last one of you will become my servant. It's a shame you won't live to see the irony."
—Tsabo Tavoc, Phyrexian general

card.name: Void
card.ability: Choose a number. Destroy all artifacts and creatures with converted mana cost equal to that number. Then target player reveals his or her hand and discards all nonland cards with converted mana cost equal to the number.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can choose zero. Token creatures and artifact lands have converted mana costs of zero, for example.

card.name: Voracious Cobra
card.ability:
First strike
Whenever Voracious Cobra deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature.
card.flavor: There's no known antidote for the cobra's venom . . . or its appetite.

card.name: Wallop
card.ability: Destroy target blue or black creature with flying.
card.flavor: In Yavimaya, flying low to join a battle can be a costly mistake.

card.name: Wandering Stream
card.ability: Domain — You gain 2 life for each basic land type among lands you control.
card.flavor:
"Dominaria touches us all."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.

Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control -- they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

card.name: Wax // Wane
card.ability:
Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
//
Destroy target enchantment.

card.name: Wash Out
card.ability: Return all permanents of the color of your choice to their owners' hands.
card.flavor:
"Rest now. You've neither won nor lost, but this battle is over for you just the same."
—Teferi

card.name: Wayfaring Giant
card.ability: Domain — Wayfaring Giant gets +1/+1 for each basic land type among lands you control.
card.flavor: Its stature and stride increase with each step it takes.
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.
2/1/2009 : How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.
2/1/2009 : A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control -- they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

card.name: Well-Laid Plans
card.ability: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to a creature by another creature if they share a color.
card.flavor: "I knew this day would come," said Urza. Looking at the destruction, Barrin sighed, "You don't have to revel in it."

card.name: Whip Silk
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
{G}: Return Whip Silk to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Llanowar forges weapons of steel. Yavimaya grows her weapons within.

card.name: Wings of Hope
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3 and has flying.
card.flavor: Urza knew Phyrexians would come through the air and sent his soldiers to greet them.

card.name: Winnow
card.ability:
Destroy target nonland permanent if another permanent with the same name is on the battlefield.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Strength in numbers? I think not."
—Gerrard

card.name: Worldly Counsel
card.ability: Domain — Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of basic land types among lands you control. Put one of those cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You choose the order on the bottom of your library.
2/1/2009 : To determine the number of basic land types among lands you control, look at the lands you have on the battlefield and ask yourself whether the subtypes Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest appear within that group. The number of times you say yes (topping out at five) tells you how powerful your domain abilities will be.
2/1/2009 : How many lands you control of a particular basic land type is irrelevant to a domain ability, as long as that number is greater than zero. As far as domain is concerned, ten Forests is the same as one Forest.
2/1/2009 : A number of nonbasic lands have basic land types. Domain abilities don't count the number of lands you control -- they count the number of basic land types among lands you control, even if that means checking the same land twice. For example, if you control a Tundra, an Overgrown Tomb, and a Madblind Mountain, you'll have a Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, and Forest among the lands you control. Your domain abilities will be maxed out.

card.name: Yavimaya Barbarian
card.ability: Protection from blue
card.flavor: Not all elves embrace the pastoral life. Some still roam the forest's edge, forever making war against their hated enemies.

card.name: Yavimaya Kavu
card.ability:
Yavimaya Kavu's power is equal to the number of red creatures on the battlefield.
Yavimaya Kavu's toughness is equal to the number of green creatures on the battlefield.
card.flavor: Kavu hunt prey in packs—one kavu hunts a pack of prey.

card.name: Yawgmoth's Agenda
card.ability:
You can't cast more than one spell each turn.
You may play cards from your graveyard.
If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere, exile it instead.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The cards in your graveyard are not considered to be in your hand for any reason. For example, you can't discard them.
10/4/2004 : You count spells that were cast this turn before this card enters the battlefield. (The Invasion FAQ is not correct on this point.)
10/4/2004 : It will exile itself if it is going to the graveyard from the battlefield.

card.name: Zanam Djinn
card.ability:
Flying
Zanam Djinn gets -2/-2 as long as blue is the most common color among all permanents or is tied for most common.

card.name: Zap
card.ability:
Zap deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: "All this time I thought Squee was useless," chuckled Sisay. "Who knew he'd be such a good shot?"
